comments:
This is my first install so it may be something I've done wrong but I believe I installed all the dependencies and have met all the requirements

After installing BIRT I started Eclipse and created a new BIRT project with no problems. Following the tutorial I selected the new -> Report. Entered the name of the new report and selected next, picked the "Group Listing" report template and clicked finish. The dialogue box flickered (as if it had done something) but then remained the same, so I clicked finish once more and the following error dialogue appeared

An unexpected internal exception occurred.Please see log for detail.
  Plug-in Provider:Eclipse.org
  Plug-in Name:BIRT Designer UI
  Plug-in ID:org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui
  Version:2.0.0
  Error Code:Error.GUIException.invokedByUnexpectedException
  Error Message:org.eclipse.ui.internal.ErrorEditorPart


After closing the error dialogue a report page is in the main window but grey with the message:

Unable to create this part due to an internal error. Reason for the failure: An exception was thrown during initialization

Details: -

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.ui.part.FileEditorInput

Tim, which version of Eclipse platform you are using?

Looks the file fails to open.
Could you try to open a simple design file withou any contents?
Looks it's working on my PC.
Could you please provide more info like version of eclipse, GEF,EMF, OS, and etc?

Thanks for the quick response

OS: Ubuntu linux hoary

Eclipse ver:
Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050627-1435

EMF appears to have many different parts to it, some of which are ver 2.1.1 and some of which are ver 2.1.0. I'm not sure if this is normal or if they should all report the same version number? For Example:

EMF Annotated Java Importer ver 2.1.1
EMF Ant Tasks ver 2.1.0

GEF is version 3.1.1


I tried to open the "customers.rptdesign" that I downloaded from the tutorial:

http://www.eclipse.org/birt/tutorial/basic/

but got the same error message.
Do you open the file in navigator view or using open external file action to open a file outside of workspace?
I originally tried through the navigator but I've also just tried through the open external file with the same result.

Try to refresh the file in navigator by the context menu.
Looks your file in navigator view is out of sync with the file in file system.
We dont' support open file by open extrenal file action for eclipse treat file in and out workspec with different way. That's all right to get that exception.
I tried a refresh but no change in behavior, same error.
*** Bug 123297 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This was the first time I used Ubuntu, so I knew little about it. Probably the season was that the browser didn't config correctly. 
So I trid to execute the command:
 export MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME="/usr/lib/mozilla-firefox"
before executing BIRT.
Maybe I did error again, the following error message was shown:

No more handles (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /home/frank/workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/BIRT/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/144/1/.cp/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3139.so: libstdc++.so.5: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory)

In order to resolve your bug, I must overcome my problem first. For your bug was not the same as mine, maybe you could help me resolve this problem, thank you very much.

I can't offer any specific help as to whats wrong as I don't know the distro that well but here is what I used to install Firefox 1.5 on my ubuntu box with no problems:

https://wiki.ubuntu.com/FirefoxNewVersion

I've trid Version 2.0.0 Build <20051231-0746> many times, but the problem  doesn't occur, it works well here.
Please make sure you don't have the RCP plugin installed. The same issue is reported if you have both IDE and RCP design UI plugin installed.

I've had a look and I do have the RCP plugin installed! I don't remember installing it specifically but perhaps it came with another plugin (I'm using the JBOSS packaged version of Eclipse so perhaps they include it in that).

When I get some time I'll install a fresh copy of eclipse and try BIRT again.

Thanks for all your help guys.

Tim
I have removed all plugins with RCP in their name, but it still doesn't work

Hi, Beno?t, can you provide us the error information.

Before you tell us error information, please make sure the versions first.
 Eclipse: 3.0 or higher (3.1 is suggested)
 BIRT: 2.0 RC1 or higher (The latest release version is suggested)
 EMF: 2.1 or higher (2.1 is suggested)
 GEF: 3.1 or higher (3.1 is suggested)
 Firefox: 1.5 is suggested

If the versions met the demands, please check if you export the following path:
 JAVA_HOME, CLASSPATH, PATH and MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME

If your directory is in some ones needing root privileges, please make sure that you're using root account or you have root privileges.

I hope what I said can help you, thanks.

Hi, Beno?t,
Because of Chinese Spring Festival, maybe I'll be away for half a month.
I don't know why it doesn't work there.
If you follow the Comment #17, the issue still exist, you can try the following steps to run birt.I hope it'll work.(The following steps is not a must, but It should does work)

1.Install JDK 1.4.2 or higher.
2.Install Eclipse 3.1 or higher.
3.install EMF 2.1 and GEF 3.1
4.If your firefox isn't Version 1.5, you'd better update it, please try to follow the guide https://wiki.ubuntu.com/FirefoxNewVersion
6. Try to change to the root accout.
    -- Open terminal, type sudo -s
    -- type password 
5. Export the paths needed:
   Suppose you installed JDK in the directory /home/frank/PrgFile/j2sk1.4.2_09 and firefox in /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox, then type
    export JAVA_HOME=/home/frank/PrgFile/j2sk1.4.2_09
    export CLASSPATH=.:$JAVA_HOME/lib/dt.jar;$JAVA_HOME/lib/tools.jar
    export PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME/bin
    exprot MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/usr/lib/mozilla-firefox

6. After do that, you can change to eclipse's direcotry, and type :
   ./eclipse -vm /home/frank/PrgFile/j2sdk1.4.2_09/bin/java

then you can use BIRT to create report designs.

I hope what I said above does work there.

Hi Xiong!

Thank you for your help : I think that I can test it tomorrow (French time).
I will report the result.

Have an happy festival!

Xiong,

Sorry for the comment #20 : I have forgotten to enter an explanation!

I wonder if I am going to wait for the next version of ubuntu in april with firefox 1.5 fully integrated : Birt works well on Windows and, for now, it is enough for me

Thank you

I had the same bug with :

- ubuntu breezy badger 5.04
- eclipse 3.1.3
- birt 2.0.1
- emf 2.1.2
- gef 3.1.1
- firefox 1.0.7

Reading the above thread helped a lot (thanks!) and the problem was solved by adding the following export to my bash_rc :

export MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/usr/lib/mozilla-firefox
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME

Second export is to help birt locates the libxpcom.so library.
Please see comments #22

traces.message: No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path (MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)]
